content: Can you modify the Python code from the given prompt to only select activities that can be done indoors? The code should ensure that at least two of the selected activities are mentally stimulating and at least one activity involves physical exercise. The list of activities remains the same. The code should also print the selected activities without repeating any activity.

To achieve the specified requirements, we need to filter the list of activities to only those that can be done indoors, ensure that at least two activities are mentally stimulating, and include at least one physical exercise activity. Here is an example of how you might modify the Python code to accomplish this:

```python
import random

# List of activities
activities = [
    {"name": "Read a book", "type": "mental", "indoor": True},
    {"name": "Solve a puzzle", "type": "mental", "indoor": True},
    {"name": "Play chess", "type": "mental", "indoor": True},
    {"name": "Yoga", "type": "physical", "indoor": True},
    {"name": "Meditation", "type": "mental", "indoor": True},
    {"name": "Write a story", "type": "mental", "indoor": True},
    {"name": "Dance", "type": "physical", "indoor": True},
    {"name": "Home workout", "type": "physical", "indoor": True},
    {"name": "Cook a new recipe", "type": "mental", "indoor": True},
    {"name": "Paint or draw", "type": "mental", "indoor": True},
    {"name": "Learn a new language", "type": "mental", "indoor": True},
    {"name": "Play video games", "type": "mental", "indoor": True},
    {"name": "Jigsaw puzzle", "type": "mental", "indoor": True},
]

def select_activities(activities):
    # Filter activities that can be done indoors
    indoor_activities = [activity for activity in activities if activity["indoor"]]

    # Separate activities by type
    mental_activities = [activity for activity in indoor_activities if activity["type"] == "mental"]
    physical_activities = [activity for activity in indoor_activities if activity["type"] == "physical"]

    # Ensure at least two mentally stimulating activities
    selected_mental = random.sample(mental_activities, 2)

    # Ensure at least one physical exercise activity
    selected_physical = random.sample(physical_activities, 1)

    # Combine selected activities
    selected_activities = selected_mental + selected_physical

    # Print selected activities without repeating any activity
    for activity in selected_activities:
        print(activity["name"])

# Call the function to select and print activities
select_activities(activities)
```

This code will randomly select two mentally stimulating indoor activities and one physical exercise activity from the given list, ensuring no activity is repeated in the output. The `random.sample` function is used to randomly choose activities from the filtered lists.
